question: The vapor pressure of pure benzene and methyl benzene at 27°C is given as 80 Torr and 24 Torr, respectively. The mole fraction of methyl benzene in vapor phase, in equilibrium with an equimolar mixture of those two liquids is:
If the degree of dissociation of aqueous solution of weak monobasic acid is 0.3, then the observed freezing point will be _________% higher than the expected/theoretical freezing point.
The reaction at cathode in the cells commonly used in clocks involves:
Time required for 99.9% completion of a first order reaction is _________ times the time required for 90% completion.
Fusion of MnO2 with KOH and an oxidising agent gives dark green K2MnO4. Manganate ion on electrolytic oxidation in alkaline medium gives permanganate ion.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
correctOption: II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE

question: Coagulation of egg on heating is because of:
options: Biological properties of proteins remain unchanged
Breaking of peptide linkage in the primary structure of protein occurs
The secondary structure of protein remains unchanged

question: Which of the following has the highest number of unpaired electrons?
The higher oxidation states are more stable down the group among transition elements unlike p-block elements. Copper cannot liberate hydrogen from weak acids.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
correctOption: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE

question: N(CH3)3 and P(CH3)3 can act as ligands. As N and P are from same group, the nature of bonding is always same with transition metals.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
correctOption: I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE

question: The incorrect statements regarding enzymes are:
options: Enzymes are non-specific and cannot catalyse different kinds of reactions.
Enzyme - oxidase catalyses the hydrolysis of maltose into glucose.
correctOption: Enzyme - oxidase catalyses the hydrolysis of maltose into glucose.

question: Phenol treated with chloroform in presence of sodium hydroxide, then hydrolyzed in acid results in:
Common name of Benzene - 1,2 - diol is:
High concentration of strong nucleophilic reagent with secondary alkyl halides will follow SN2 mechanism. Secondary alkyl halide with excess ethanol follows SN1 mechanism.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
correctOption: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE

question: Haloalkanes react with KCN to form alkyl cyanides, but with AgCN form isocyanides. KCN and AgCN are highly ionic compounds.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
correctOption: I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE

question: p-nitrophenol is more acidic than m- and o-nitrophenol. Ethanol will give immediate turbidity with Lucas reagent.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
correctOption: I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE

question: Which nitrogen compound does not give Lassaigne's test?
Kjeldahl method is applicable to pyridine. The nitrogen in pyridine can be converted to ammonium sulfate.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
correctOption: BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE

question: The molecular formula of second homologue in the mono carboxylic acids series is:
Acidity of α-hydrogens of aldehydes and ketones is responsible for Aldol reaction. Benzaldehyde and ethanal will not give Cross-Aldol product.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
correctOption: I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE

question: Which compound will not give silver mirror with ammoniacal AgNO3?

The IUPAC name of CH3CHO is
Which one of the following conformation of cyclohexane is chiral?
The alkene that exhibits geometrical isomerism is:
The gas liberated by the electrolysis of Dipotassium succinate solution is:
From the following statements regarding H2O2, choose the incorrect statement
options: It can act only as an oxidizing agent
It has to be stored in plastic or wax-lined glass bottles in the dark
It has to be kept away from dust
It decomposes on exposure to light
correctOption: It can act only as an oxidizing agent

question: The metal that cannot be obtained by electrolysis of an aqueous solution of its salt is

options: increase in amount of dissolved oxygen in water

dissociation of CaSO4(s) to CaO(s) and SO3(g)
correctOption: synthesis of ammonia from N2 and H2

question: Number of atoms in the following samples of substances is the largest in:
The shape of carbocation is:

options: Atoms of different elements differ in mass.
Compounds are formed when atoms of different element combine in a fixed ratio.
Chemical reactions involve reorganisation of atoms.

question: At constant temperature, a gas is at a pressure of 940.3 mm Hg. The pressure at which its volume decreases by 40% is __________ mm Hg.
The element having the highest first ionization enthalpy is
Statement I: Fluorine has most negative electron gain enthalpy in its group. Statement II: Oxygen has least negative electron gain enthalpy in its group.
options: BOTH I AND II ARE TRUE
BOTH I AND II ARE FALSE
I IS TRUE BUT II IS FALSE
II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
correctOption: II IS TRUE BUT I IS FALSE
